Posts.Content: greentree765 wrote: hello everyone, i was hoping someone could help me make sense of my report. i have had 3 years of mammo's now, the first baseline returned normal, second year was called back for another mammo and ultrasound that showed "multiple nodules" and "nothing to be concerned about" , this time around again was sent for another mammo and ultrasound because changes were seen. I have received my report and was told to come back in 4 months for yet another mammo and ultrasound. my concern is that there is alot of stuff going on in my left breast according to the report, i have hadÂ no symptoms and have never felt any lumps, although the last couple days i have had some localized pain deep in my left breast, any way i dont know if i should wait or attempt to see another physician my report states the following multiple predominantly cystic nodules noted. largest measuring 15x16x7 mm in 10 oclock position, smaller 7x6x5 mm nodules. 6.5x3x3 mm nodule with echogenic center consistent with lymph node noted. of note is a 2.5x3.1 mm hypoechoic nodule. internal echoes are seen. small size difficult to further characterize. impression, multiple predominantly simple but also complex cysts and lymph nodes 4 month follow up to confirm stability bi-rads 3 probably benign finding anyone else out there with more junk in their breast than breast tissue? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: to wait or not to wait greentree765 mommaof5
